result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Edward Niedzielski III

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. Includes 19CF156, 22CF612 and 22CF649. SEALED. kma     to rg

- Defendant approved to test through Onyx Sober House, testing through  JSC is no longer necessary at this time. 
 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

9:52 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Edward Niedzielski III in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Joseph Edward Niedzielski III.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF612 & 22CF649.  Court reviews file.  Atty Satorius states there is not an offer at this time, asking to set a PLEAS after matter in Branch II clears up. Tina Sitz from JSC is here in person and makes statements.  Court modifies bond on 22CF612.  bph

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Satorius. kma

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.  I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:22 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Edward Niedzielski III in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Joseph Edward Niedzielski III.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. DE does qualify for PD.  DE states he doesn't really have an address but can send mail to address on file. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Bond argument.  Court orders bond and sets next hearing. Adjourned at 1:25 PM. bph
